title: Team GB chief slams Olympic Village food which has seen athletes served raw meat - with chicken and eggs rationed | talkSPORT
text:
Olympics Team GB chief slams Olympic Village food which has seen athletes served raw meat – with chicken and eggs rationed Jake Lambourne Published : 23:05, 25 Jul 2024 Updated : 23:10, 25 Jul 2024 Team GB have been forced into drafting in an emergency chef with athletes served raw meat at the Olympic Village.
British Olympic Association chief executive Andy Anson has hit out at the quality of food in Paris, which has seen chicken and eggs being rationed.
3 Athletes are alleged to have been served uncooked meat at the Olympic Village Credit: Getty Paris 2024 organisers have boasted in the build-up to the Games that Michelin chefs would be catering the athletes.
But a food shortage and claims of uncooked meat have seen the Team GB camp bringing in an extra chef to their private performance lodge in Clichy.
Anson said: "At the beginning of every Games there’s usually two or three issues.

“And then there is the quality of the food, with raw meat being served to athletes.
“They have got to improve it over the next couple of days dramatically.

“The athletes are not going there just to eat their lunch, they are packing meals for their dinner as they don’t want to go into the athlete restaurant to eat.

Meanwhile, an unnamed British athlete told The Times : "The food is a challenge at the moment.
"They are not as organised as you’d expect and the Japanese [at the previous Olympics] were so organised.
"Now it is chaos with loads of people coming in the last few days.
